title: L1-Regularized Distributed Optimization: A Communication-Efficient Primal-Dual Framework
abstract: Despite the importance of sparsity in many big data applications, there are few existing methods for efficient distributed optimization of sparsely-regularized objectives. In this paper, we present a communication-efficient framework for L1-regularized optimization in distributed environments. By taking a non-traditional view of classical objectives as part of a more general primal-dual setting, we obtain a new class of methods that can be efficiently distributed and is applicable to common L1-regularized regression and classification objectives, such as Lasso, sparse logistic regression, and elastic net regression. We provide convergence guarantees for this framework and demonstrate strong empirical performance as compared to other state-of-the-art methods on several real-world distributed datasets.
